00044   // simple operations
00045 
00046 #define idxop_ii(i1,i2,op_idx0, op_idx1, op_contig, op_recursive, op_any) { \
00047     intg N1=(i1).nelements();                                           \
00048     intg N2 =(i2).nelements();                                          \
00049     if (N1 != N2)                                                       \
00050       { ylerror("idx_op: Idxs have different number of elements\n"); }  \
00051     if ( ((i1).order() == 0) && ((i2).order() == 0) ) {                 \
00052       /* they are 1D vectors of the same size, use the stride version */ \
00053       op_idx0;                                                          \
00054     } else if ( (i1).contiguousp() && (i2).contiguousp() ) {            \
00055       /* they are both contiguous: call the stride 1 routine */         \
00056       op_contig;                                                        \
00057     } else if ( ((i1).order() == 1) && ((i2).order() == 1) ) {          \
00058       /* they are 1D vectors of the same size, use the stride version */ \
00059       op_idx1;                                                          \
00060     } else if ( same_dim((i1).spec,(i2).spec) ) {                       \
00061       op_recursive;                                                     \
00062     } else {                                                            \
00063       /* else, they don't have the same structure: do it "by hand".     \
00064          This is slower */                                              \
00065       op_any;                                                           \
00066     }                                                                   \
00067   }
00068 
00069 #define idxop_simple_ii(i1,i2,op_idx0, op_idx1, op_contig,              \
00070                         op_recursive, op_any) {                         \
00071     intg N1=(i1).nelements();                                           \
00072     intg N2 =(i2).nelements();                                          \
00073     if (N1 != N2)                                                       \
00074       { ylerror("idx_op: Idxs have different number of elements\n"); }  \
00075     if ( ((i1).order() == 0) && ((i2).order() == 0) ) {                 \
00076       /* they are 1D vectors of the same size, use the stride version */ \
00077       op_idx0;                                                          \
00078     } else if ( (i1).contiguousp() && (i2).contiguousp() ) {            \
00079       /* they are both contiguous: call the stride 1 routine */         \
00080       op_contig;                                                        \
00081     } else if ( ((i1).order() == 1) && ((i2).order() == 1) ) {          \
00082       /* they are 1D vectors of the same size, use the stride version */ \
00083       op_idx1;                                                          \
00084     } else if ( same_dim((i1).spec,(i2).spec) ) {                       \
00085       op_recursive;                                                     \
00086     } else {                                                            \
00087       /* else, they don't have the same structure: do it "by hand".     \
00088          This is slower */                                              \
00089       op_any;                                                           \
00090     }                                                                   \
00091   }
